query: Summarize each document's main purpose in one sentence.
answer:
1. Builder’s Limited Warranty (Fabrikam–Contoso home) – The document titled “BUILDERS LIMITED WARRANTY WITH ARBITRATION” sets out Fabrikam Inc.’s one‑year and sixty‑day limited warranty obligations to Contoso Ltd. for a newly constructed home, including coverage scope, exclusions, claim procedures, non‑transferability, and mandatory binding arbitration of most disputes.[7][4][10][14]

2. Term / Exclusions / Arbitration sections excerpt – The repeated “2. Term.” / exclusions / arbitration text provides the detailed operative clauses of the same Builder’s Limited Warranty, specifying when coverage begins, when it ends (after one (1) year or sixty (60) days), what is excluded, and how arbitration is to be conducted under Idaho law and AAA rules.[1][4][7][10][14]

3. Holding Tank Servicing Contract – The “HOLDING TANK SERVICING CONTRACT” defines the ongoing service relationship between Contoso Ltd. (holding tank owner) and Fabrikam Inc. (pumper) for a holding tank at 123 Mockup Lane in Washburn County, WI, including access rights, reporting duties to the County, and contract termination/change filing requirements.[2]

4. Vertical Platform Lift Purchase Contract – The “PURCHASE CONTRACT” between Contoso Lifts LLC (Contractor) and Fabrikam Inc. (Customer) governs the sale and installation of one Vertical Platform Lift (AscendPro VPX200) and related components for a total price of $29,900.00, with defined payment milestones, delivery window, risk of loss allocation, Florida governing law, warranty terms, permitting responsibilities, and a 3‑business‑day right to cancel.[3][6]

5. Exhibit A – Scope of Work (Bayfront Animal Clinic) – “EXHIBIT A - SCOPE OF WORK” describes the technical scope for installing a Vertical Platform Lift (AscendPro VPX200) and associated equipment at Bayfront Animal Clinic in Tampa, FL, including cab size 42" x 62", pit depth 3", keyless access, and site‑prep responsibilities assigned to others.[5][13]

6. Property Management Agreement (Short Term and/or Vacation/Holiday Rentals) – The “PROPERTY MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT” appoints Walt Flood Realty as exclusive agent to manage Contoso Ltd.’s vacation rental property “Pacific View Retreat” in Honolulu, HI, detailing term, agent and owner responsibilities, a fee structure (e.g., 25% of gross revenues for short‑term rentals, 10% for long‑term leases, $75.00/month advertising, $50.00/month admin, $35/hour coordination), a $250.00 non‑refundable start‑up fee, liability/hold‑harmless provisions, and Hawaii governing law.[8][11][12]

7. Contoso Lifts LLC Invoice – The “INVOICE # 1256003” from Contoso Lifts LLC to Fabrikam Construction itemizes the sale of a Vertical Platform Lift (Savaria V1504) and related components totaling $29,900.00, documenting quantities, unit prices, the customer and ship‑to details, and noting that the amount is due on contract signing in accordance with the related contract.[9]

8. Arbitration Program / Entire Agreement / Invalidity excerpt – The standalone arbitration/entire‑agreement/invalidity section reiterates and elaborates the arbitration program from the Builder’s Limited Warranty, clarifying arbitrator powers, preservation of remedies (e.g., small claims up to $3,000), confidentiality, survival, and that the warranty and Statement of Non‑Warranted Conditions constitute the entire integrated agreement between Contoso Ltd. (Buyer/Owner) and Fabrikam Inc. (Builder).[10][14]

full_result.response:
1. Builder’s Limited Warranty (Fabrikam–Contoso home) – The document titled “BUILDERS LIMITED WARRANTY WITH ARBITRATION” sets out Fabrikam Inc.’s one‑year and sixty‑day limited warranty obligations to Contoso Ltd. for a newly constructed home, including coverage scope, exclusions, claim procedures, non‑transferability, and mandatory binding arbitration of most disputes.[7][4][10][14]

2. Term / Exclusions / Arbitration sections excerpt – The repeated “2. Term.” / exclusions / arbitration text provides the detailed operative clauses of the same Builder’s Limited Warranty, specifying when coverage begins, when it ends (after one (1) year or sixty (60) days), what is excluded, and how arbitration is to be conducted under Idaho law and AAA rules.[1][4][7][10][14]

3. Holding Tank Servicing Contract – The “HOLDING TANK SERVICING CONTRACT” defines the ongoing service relationship between Contoso Ltd. (holding tank owner) and Fabrikam Inc. (pumper) for a holding tank at 123 Mockup Lane in Washburn County, WI, including access rights, reporting duties to the County, and contract termination/change filing requirements.[2]

4. Vertical Platform Lift Purchase Contract – The “PURCHASE CONTRACT” between Contoso Lifts LLC (Contractor) and Fabrikam Inc. (Customer) governs the sale and installation of one Vertical Platform Lift (AscendPro VPX200) and related components for a total price of $29,900.00, with defined payment milestones, delivery window, risk of loss allocation, Florida governing law, warranty terms, permitting responsibilities, and a 3‑business‑day right to cancel.[3][6]

5. Exhibit A – Scope of Work (Bayfront Animal Clinic) – “EXHIBIT A - SCOPE OF WORK” describes the technical scope for installing a Vertical Platform Lift (AscendPro VPX200) and associated equipment at Bayfront Animal Clinic in Tampa, FL, including cab size 42" x 62", pit depth 3", keyless access, and site‑prep responsibilities assigned to others.[5][13]

6. Property Management Agreement (Short Term and/or Vacation/Holiday Rentals) – The “PROPERTY MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT” appoints Walt Flood Realty as exclusive agent to manage Contoso Ltd.’s vacation rental property “Pacific View Retreat” in Honolulu, HI, detailing term, agent and owner responsibilities, a fee structure (e.g., 25% of gross revenues for short‑term rentals, 10% for long‑term leases, $75.00/month advertising, $50.00/month admin, $35/hour coordination), a $250.00 non‑refundable start‑up fee, liability/hold‑harmless provisions, and Hawaii governing law.[8][11][12]

7. Contoso Lifts LLC Invoice – The “INVOICE # 1256003” from Contoso Lifts LLC to Fabrikam Construction itemizes the sale of a Vertical Platform Lift (Savaria V1504) and related components totaling $29,900.00, documenting quantities, unit prices, the customer and ship‑to details, and noting that the amount is due on contract signing in accordance with the related contract.[9]

8. Arbitration Program / Entire Agreement / Invalidity excerpt – The standalone arbitration/entire‑agreement/invalidity section reiterates and elaborates the arbitration program from the Builder’s Limited Warranty, clarifying arbitrator powers, preservation of remedies (e.g., small claims up to $3,000), confidentiality, survival, and that the warranty and Statement of Non‑Warranted Conditions constitute the entire integrated agreement between Contoso Ltd. (Buyer/Owner) and Fabrikam Inc. (Builder).[10][14]
